definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Ha ha. I bet they play this and then announce the event is over.
sentences.chinese: 哈，我打包票他们演奏完后宣布发布会结束。

sentences.english: Well, the Vegetable Orchestra promises just that.
sentences.chinese: 蔬菜管弦乐队可以打包票。
当然，这种事情我们不能打包票。

sentences.english: I'm sure that is just how Kate must feel now.
sentences.chinese: 我敢打包票这也是凯特现在所想。

sentences.english: But there are no guarantees, and there is much work to do.
sentences.chinese: 但是，世上没有打包票的事，要做的事情还很多。

definition: see 誇海口|夸海口[kua1 hai3 kou3]
to bet/to make a bet/a wager
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
